comment._content:
HIGGINSON WINS AT AMATEUR SHOOTING; New York A.C. Gunner Captures National Championship at Travers Island.
April 5, 1912
B.M. Higginson, Jr., a former Harvard gunner, wearing the colors of the New York A.C., won the seventh annual National championship at clay birds over the Travers Island traps of the New York A.C. yesterday. The winner made the wonderful score of 185 out of a possible 200 targets, breaking the previous record, held by former Champion H.W. Kahler, by 12 targets.
